item.title: Archangel Dating Simulator (One Shot)
item.dc:creator: @swordqueen
item.description:
@swordqueen wrote:

Fullscreen capture 1182019 104101 PM.bmp.jpg553×785 139 KB

This session is scheduled for 3 hours. The session will be recorded if everyone is cool with it! If not, no worries. We will be using Streamyard.

The divine hosts have incarnated. They’re also slightly not used to being so bodied and are slightly lost. They have this magnetic gravity and seem to be out of it. Would you so kindly, hmm. Date them?

You have karma to unravel! And boy is your penance looking bad/great/good. In a series of dates you will discover what divine love looks like on this earthly plane. What will your karmic dance look like? Can you stay together, or will fate drive you apart?

ARCHANGEL DATING SIMULATOR is a story game that uses tarot cards as a intuitive tool for your creativity. All of us will weave a story of love (or heartbreak!) between two (or more!) people.

Safety tools: We will be using script change, lines and veils, and an open door policy. We can change these tools to whatever suits the table best. This game follows The Gauntlet’s Inclusivity Policy.

One shot: 2019-12-07T01:00:00Z https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LtAYEL1htilsCetFxGm

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

item.source: Archangel Dating Simulator (One Shot)

item.title: Bite Marks: Northern Souls
item.dc:creator: @DavidMorrison
item.description:
@DavidMorrison wrote:

northern_soul_wolf.jpg974×1000 635 KB

This is the first in a series of four sessions of Bite Marks by Becky Annison of Black Armada Games. Bite Marks is a game in which you play a pack of werewolves who must maintain the balance between man and wolf, manage the deep and sometimes messy relationships within the pack, and still stand strong against their foes. Unless the video chat landscape changes between now and the game, we will probably play using the Jitsi browser-based chat tool. With the consent of all involved, this game will be recorded and later uploaded to Youtube.

It’s 1971, and in the industrial North of England the mod scene is morphing into the music and fashion movement that will be known as Northern Soul. Frequently unlicensed clubs in the factory towns and cities feature so-called “DJs”, who use new dual-turntable techniques to keep the sound of Motown flowing all night long. The working men and women seek release from the drudgery of their day-to-day lives in music, exuberant dancing, and the amphetamines that help them keep going all night long. Huntersley is a village to the North of Sheffield, the Steel City, the boundary between the heavily industrialised Don Valley and the farmlands outside. And the wolfpack who live there are also caught between two worlds. The duties and obligations of their mundane lives, and the nights when they can run free as wolves. But which will be the greater threat - the crushing inevitability of modernity, or the old secrets that dwell in the dark?

Content Warning: This game will almost certainly feature violent content, and probably consensual sexual content. The game also deals with ideas of social domination, and loss of personal control. We will have a discussion on tone and content before the game begins, as well as establishing Lines & Veils to provide a comfortable play experience. This game will take place under the Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy and the safety tools Script Change and X-Card will be in use.

Session 1 Sunday, January 5, 2020 8:00 PM → Sunday, January 5, 2020 11:00 PM
Session 2 Sunday, January 12, 2020 8:00 PM → Sunday, January 12, 2020 11:00 PM
Session 3 Sunday, January 19, 2020 8:00 PM → Sunday, January 19, 2020 11:00 PM
Session 4 Sunday, January 26, 2020 8:00 PM → Sunday, January 26, 2020 11:00 PM

item.title: Free from the Yoke (January)
item.dc:creator: @darren
item.description:
@darren wrote:

free from the yoke.JPG1149×1187 391 KB

You’ve won your revolution. What will you do with freedom? After occupation and revolution, your nation is finally free. Now you need to decide what happens next. Will you work with your fellow citizens to build a glorious new land, or forge your own path?
In Free From the Yoke, you’ll control one of 8 different Houses. These are the factions that define your new country, and through their struggles and fortunes you’ll tell your fledgling nation’s history.
You’ll also play a viewpoint Character from your House, however. Their adventures and sagas, their brushes with the supernatural and their desperate struggle on the battlefield, will help guide the course of history.
Finally, there’s the Arbiter – the organisation in control of this land. They might be the heroes of the revolutionary war, avatars of the Land itself risen up to oust the Empire, or even a governor left here by the Empire as part of their peace treaty with you. Their playbook tells you what sort of challenges they’ll force onto their subjects, what laws they’ll enforce, and how your Houses and Characters can exploit their organisation to their advantage. The Arbiter also has an Agent, a powerful free agent to add into your mix when characters go on adventures, and Projects – map-changing ambitions that will define each age of your saga.

This is the first month of the first quarter of a year-long campaign of Free from the Yoke by Jay Iles and Fyodor Kasatkin. The sessions will be scheduled month-to-month in quarterly blocks.
However, the Houses in play will be determined in the first session and will not change (barring narrative).
Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must sign up for each session you wish to attend. When a new player joins, they will take over the House of the previous player.

We’ll use Google Hangouts. I’ll email all players about a week before the first session with the necessary links.

Safety Tools: We will use Script Change and Lines and Veils during our sessions. We will observe the Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy.

all sessions on Wednesdays at 1900 EST
Session 0: https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LswSu2Uk-yinkQAQR-i
Session 1: https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LswT0SqmrdRzMZPN3H2
Session 2: https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LswTBTnQHJvjA769hCo
Session 3: https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LswTNQFSjtLHZHCenpT

item.title: Have a Familiar Ring: Gauntlet Sunday One Shot (Jan 2020)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:


This is for a one shot of Have a Familiar Ring by Jamila R. Nedjadi. Rules will be taught. In the session we’ll discuss tone, pick a prompt, choose the magic user, and get to playing.

Come together friends, and tell a story of magic.

One of you will be a magic-user. On your hand you wear many rings, each belonging to a familiar. The rest of you will play those familiars, assisting and thwarting the magic-user as you please.Together using prompts and permission to create a wild and untamed story, face the price of magic head on and write your destiny together.

  • Created for the #YourMoveJam, which stipulates working with the powered by apocalypse system to create a game centered around just ONE move.
  • No GM or Facilitator required. Only prep is to read through the game once and then just get started!
  • Evocative prompts to help you get started on your story

We will play using Zoom and record the session. We will use the X-Card as well as Lines & Veils for safety. If you sign up and your attendance or RSVP changes, please also send me a message at edige23 at gmail. I will send out a group email a week before the session with set up and invite details. The session will between 3-4 hours.

The Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy will be in play and the X-Card safety tool will be in use.

Sunday, January 12, 2020 3:00 PM → Sunday, January 12, 2020 7:00 PM Session

item.title: Take My Revolution: Gauntlet Sunday One-Shot (Jan 2020)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

This is for a one shot of Take My Revolution by Jamila R. Nedjadi. Rules will be taught. In the session we’ll discuss tone, choose the game frame, and get to playing.

Your school is beautiful but incredibly strange. There are those who call themselves Swordblooms, and they Duel each other in order to impress World’s End and gain the Divine Sword…in doing so, they will create a revolution. They’ll change the world, for the one they love.

You are now one of these Swordblooms. The school is alive, and it won’t let you leave. You have no choice. You must duel and take your revolution! Or you can fade away into the shadows…

  • Heavily inspired by the anime Revolutionary Girl Utena .
  • Mechanics are from Meguey and Vincent Baker’s excellent casual RPG games: Mobile Frame Zero: Firebrands and The King is Dead .
  • 3-5 players
  • 2-4 hours
  • No Game Master or Facilitator required
  • Casual TTRPG, easy to pick up and play
  • Pick and choose which game to play!
  • Games included are: Dreams & Revelations, An Animated Disagreement, Rising Tensions in an Elevator, A Conversation Over Food, A Dance, Meeting Sword to Sword, Stealing Time Together, Duel With Swords & Hearts, Take My Revolution, Through a Mirror Darkly, Endgame: The Sword’s Choice.

We will play using Zoom and record the session. We will use the X-Card as well as Lines & Veils for safety. If you sign up and your attendance or RSVP changes, please also send me a message at edige23 at gmail. I will send out a group email a week before the session with set up and invite details. The session will between 3-4 hours.

The Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy will be in play and the X-Card) safety tool will be in use.

Sunday, January 5, 2020 3:00 PM → Sunday, January 5, 2020 7:00 PM Session

fAFwWm.jpg1067×1600 426 KB

item.title: ALIEN the rpg by Free league publishing
item.dc:creator: @jasonzanes
item.description:
@jasonzanes wrote:

ALIEN
Here are four sessions of the ALIEN role playing game by Free League Publishing. In ALIEN you play in a universe of body horror and corporate brinkmanship, where synthetic people play god while space truckers and marines serve host to newborn ghoulish creatures. It’s a harsh and unforgiving universe and you are nothing if not expendable.

We will be playing what Free League calls a “Cinematic Scenario”. A Cinematic scenario emulates the dramatic arc of an ALIEN film. This game mode emphasizes high stakes and fast and brutal play. Conflict between player characters is likely, and you are not all expected to survive. In fact, most of your PCs probably won’t live to see the end of the scenario. If you die you’ll just jump into the body of a NPC and keep on space trucking.

CONTENT WARNING: This is a survival horror game. This may not be the game for you if you are sensitive to themes of body horror, extreme violence, sudden character death, and PvP conflict. We’ll use communication and consent tools including the X-Card, Lines/Veils, and the Open Door to help everyone have a scary fun time, but please keep the contents and premise in mind.

Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must RSVP to each session you plan to attend. The Open Door policy will be in effect but the character you play will be active in each session. Therefore, if you miss a session, your character might be played as an NPC or by another PC. If your character dies, you will have a new character to play when you return.

We will use Streamyard to play. I will record and post the session to youtube if all players consent.

Session 1
https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-Lsn_nrUkAd8J-TxSgLb

Session 2
https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-Lsna2It9iodddbG7fyr

https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LsnaElDP0xkl-_M5cRW

https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LsnaQArzDfQQjMA96wJ

item.title: Black Friday Gauntlet League Wrestling
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

GLW Banner.jpg1800×600 884 KB

WRESTLE ALL THE THINGS! CONQUER ALL THE ARENAS! SEIZE THE GAUNTLET!

Gauntlet League Wrestling! After a season of changes, management goes on the road to test out new talent.

This World Wide Wrestling session will have quick character set up followed by everyone fighting for the prize-- a contract with the promotion. A curated set of playbooks will be available. Feel free to recreate past characters. No experience necessary with pro wrestling or the rules, everything will be taught in a friendly environment.

If you’ve been curious about World Wide Wrestling, come in and try it out. It’s fun and furious for any and all. Your Creative’s a relative newb to Pro-Wrestling so we’ll all advance together.

Move lists and playbooks will be posted ahead of time. Content Warning: Some wrestling gimmicks and storylines can hit on problematic areas. We will discuss tone and use the X-Card for safety.

The session will last 3-4 hours. We will be using Zoom for the meeting and recording the session. IF YOU SIGN UP, PLEASE ADD THIS TO YOUR CALENDAR. LET’S GET IT ON!!!

Friday, November 29, 2019 7:00 PM → Friday, November 29, 2019 11:00 PM Session 1

item.title: Gauntlet Calendar Reminder
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

With it being the first of November, the Gauntlet Calendar open up for (checks notes) January? We still have room in December, though the holidays often make a mess of schedules. A few reminders for those posting events.

  • Please post your events to both the Gauntlet Forum and the Slack. We have members who don’t participate in the Slack but who have RSVP access. It’s also important to have events there in public for those interested in playing who don’t back the Patreon. If you have to choose, please post on the Forum over Slack.
  • GMs- it is legit to mark the first 48 or 72 hours of access as restricted to a particular group who might otherwise not get access: new Gauntleteers, people you haven’t run for yet, members of a marginalized community. If you do so, make sure you put that at the top of your event description both on the calendar and when you post it on the Forums or Slack.
  • If you’re wondering what to run, look around for what games people are asking about. On the flip side, if you’re a player looking for a particular game or even particular time, maybe talk about that. GMs- if you have someone make a request, feel free to save them a seat. Just post the session with one fewer players.
  • If you’re planning on recording your event, make sure you say that in your event description. It’s also important to tell people if you’ll be contacting them via a group email. Finally, given the state of our video options it’s a decent idea to mention what you’ll be using for the session (Streamyard, jitsi, Zoom, etc).
  • There is a known bug that if you create an event with the exact same name as a previously created event, the system won’t post it (but also delightfully won’t give you an error message).

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Gauntlet Calendar Reminder

item.title: Thirsty Sword Lesbians: Queen of Thieves (Friday evenings in December)
item.dc:creator: @Bethany_H
item.description:
@Bethany_H wrote:

For nearly a decade, you’ve been robbing rich nobles who pass through your forest. They’ve never managed to catch you or find your hideout. Admittedly, they didn’t try that hard. They had bigger things to worry about. As long as you didn’t get too greedy, you weren’t considered much of a threat.

But the new Sheriff is ruthless, vengeful, and has vowed to wipe out every last outlaw in the forest, and you’ll need all your fighting, seduction, and/or magic skills to save your village.

Yes, this is exactly what it sounds like. Queer Robin Hood, using the PbtA adventure/romance game Thirsty Sword Lesbians.

Participants: 1

item.title: Hearts of Wulin for fans (or potential fans) of wuxia (oneshots using simplified playtest rules)
item.dc:creator: @brushmen
item.description:
@brushmen wrote:

[GAME DOC] simplified oneshot documentation (examples of simplification: only 1 entanglement per player-character, faction optional, direct romance optional, playbook role’s custom moves limited to its titular custom move)

These oneshots are meant to be independent of each other, such that anyone can join any session and only play one session. But if at any time the same group of players continues to play together, I’m happy to extend storylines for the same characters. (I really want to play a campaign anyway )

item.title: Star Wars Saturdays: Ghost Orbit (Saturday mornings in December)
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

TZXIj6b.png1073×1073 533 KB

NEW BLOOD INITIATIVE!

Until November 1st, please ONLY sign up for this one-shot if you’ve joined the Patreon within the last six months OR if you’ve never played in one of my Star Wars Saturdays games

The Empire is falling to pieces across the galaxy and you all have escaped the Star Destroyer were you were stationed. Somehow, you’ve ended up working on Prospero’s Dream.

That’s correct, you’re playing ex-Imperials. The Rebellion won. You’re just trying to survive the aftermath.

For this game, I’m using Ghost Orbit to run the module Mothership: A Pound of Flesh.

GHOST ORBIT is an analog role-playing game about things breaking in space.

You can expect to encounter gross neglect, runaway fires, explosive decompression, labor riots, hostile aliens, and maybe literal ghosts. The players take on the role of IWW Union Spacers trying to survive the day everything went pear-shaped. We play to find out how the spacers survive, and what they lose in the process.

Mothership: A Pound of Flesh is a toolkit for building your own run-down, back-water, black market space station.

This game is part of the ongoing Star Wars Saturdays series. The time setting is the end of Episode VI of the Star Wars movie series (that’s Return of the Jedi) when the Empire was in control, Jedi were few and hunted, and the rebellion was growing in fits and starts. Characters and settings created in this miniseries will exist in the SWS canon for future miniseries.

Being able to attend every session is not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend. We will be using the X-Card as well as Roses and Thorns after each session.

Saturday, December 14, 2019 2:00 PM → Saturday, December 14, 2019 5:00 PM Session 1
Saturday, December 21, 2019 2:00 PM → Saturday, December 21, 2019 5:00 PM Session 2
Saturday, December 28, 2019 2:00 PM → Saturday, December 28, 2019 5:00 PM Session 3

item.title: [Gauntlet Comics] December One-Shots! (Tuesday nights)
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

In December, I’m running three different one-shots on Tuesday nights.

NEW BLOOD INITIATIVE!

Until November 1st, please ONLY sign up for this one-shot if you’ve joined the Patreon within the last six months OR if you’ve never played in one of my Gauntlet Comics games

nPt0gRc.jpg2525×2513 935 KB

Splinter City is a story roleplaying game about the citizens of a famous metropolis, known for its iconic superheroes and titanic battles. But what happens on the days when skyscrapers aren’t being turned to cinder by the mighty fist of the Super Squadron? The characters of Splinter City are just normal Joes, trying to get by in a world that is sometimes too chaotic.

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Wednesday, December 4, 2019 1:00 AM → Wednesday, December 4, 2019 4:00 AM Splinter City

FUoUtTB.jpg2525×2513 1.15 MB

Finally, you can play the superhero dating show game you’ve always wanted. Will Flying Alien Journalist end up with Vigilante Detective? Will Comedian Speedster decide to settle down with Super-Healing Veteran? Only you and your friends can decide. Superhero Romance gives you eight characters and a brief introduction, everything you need to turn Singularity into a dating show game about comic book supers competing to form a romantic and crime-fighting duo. These folks are looking for “partners” in both sense of the word.

This game is a setting hack for the transhuman dating show game Singularity .

Wednesday, December 11, 2019 1:00 AM → Wednesday, December 11, 2019 4:00 AM Superhero Romance

4tP48Tt.jpg2525×2513 1.27 MB

Superspeed might make your commute faster, but once you are at work you still have to do your day job if you want to pay the bills. We don’t tell superhero stories about people who used their powers to become independently wealthy so they could fight crime more effectively. No, we tell stories about people with powers struggling with the same day to day issues we struggle with, despite their super powers. Why? It’s the people and the world they live in that make the stories interesting and that is what you are about to play – the most interesting part of superhero stories, the stories of the bystanders.

In this playset, you live in a world with superheroes and villains, but you’re not one of them. You are in the orbit of one, or affected by the elements of a super-powered world that are out of control of the normal non-powered people. You may intersect the lives of the heroes and villains (and probably will) but you’re still an outsider in your own world.

Wednesday, December 18, 2019 1:00 AM → Wednesday, December 18, 2019 4:00 AM Bystanders!

Each one-shot game session is part of the ongoing Gauntlet Comics series. Characters and settings created in this miniseries will exist in the Gauntlet Comics canon (and on our wiki) for future miniseries.

The X-Card safety tool will be on the table. Lines and Veils will be in place as well.

For more information on the Gauntlet’s safety tools, please refer to our Inclusivity Policy on the website (http://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html)

Game sessions will be recorded for future publication.

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: [Gauntlet Comics] December One-Shots! (Tuesday nights)

item.title: Star Wars Saturday One-Shot: Droids (a reskin of Skeletons) Nov 30th
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

ShHfz4H.jpg799×799 201 KB

Jabba’s Palace

Shortly following his death…

The death of Jabba on his sail barge leaves some questions. Most of his court died in a fiery explosion, but not everyone. What became of Jabba’s droids after his death? What became of his palace in the sands?

This game seeks to answer these questions using the framework of Jason Morningstar’s The Skeletons. Instead of skeletons defending an ancient tomb, you will play as droids, recently awoken from their scheduled memory wipes, to a palace they no longer recognize.

The fleeing bodyguards and slaves ransacked the palace, leaving behind traces of luxury and cruelty. The sands stretch far and wide. Jawas would certainly take any droid that leaves. A spark of independence and freedom from servitude exists here, but interlopers from outside seek to take the palace. The sands intrude.

Time, and The Force, echo in these empty halls.

Awaken droids, and defend the palace!

THE SKELETONS is meditative structured freeform game for 1-6 players. You’ll need a few hours and a private space.

This game is part of the ongoing Star Wars Saturdays series. The time setting is Episode VI of the Star Wars movie series (that’s Return of the Jedi) when the Empire was in control, Jedi were few and hunted, and the rebellion was growing in fits and starts. Characters and settings created in this session will exist in the SWS canon for future miniseries.We will be using the X-Card as well as Roses and Thorns after the session.This game session will be recorded.

Saturday, November 30, 2019 3:00 PM → Saturday, November 30, 2019 6:00 PM One-shot

item.title: Night's Black Operators - The Lisky Bratva
item.dc:creator: @Alun_R
item.description:
@Alun_R wrote:

Night’s Black Operators: The Lisky Bratva (1/5)
… starring @Sabine V. @Stephen Humphreys, @Pawel & @Puckett (he/him)
The theft of a laptop from a NATO Conference in Sarajevo leads the team to a rural cemetery, where their pay-off goes wrong and turns into a job offer. Cut to Odessa from where the brutal and uncompromising Josef Lisky runs a criminal empire across eastern Europe, and where Donald Carrol briefs them on their operation: to follow a shipment of tagged military hardware from Odessa Sea Port to its destination. There follows some breaking and entering, some imaginative use of balloons and drones, and a confrontation with a cretaure with very strange properties …

item.title: Gauntlet Comics—Sunset Kills: Break the Darkness
item.dc:creator: @Alexi_Sarge
item.description:
@Alexi_Sarge wrote:

Gauntlet Comics—Sunset Kills: Break the Darkness

Sunset Kills graphic 1.jpg564×865 406 KB

“Even in a city of heroes, it takes a special sort of individual to fight back the things that go bump in the night. Renegade cops who washed out of Precinct 13. Quixotic would-be revivers of destroyed mystic legacies. Snooping reporters who just can’t leave well enough alone, even if it gets them killed. Yeah. That kind of special individual. Good luck, New Gauntlet City.”

We’ll be playing Sunset Kills by Jesse Ross, a streamlined PbtA game of modern-day monster-hunting, in the Gauntlet Comics continuity on two Wednesdays in November.

Sessions will run three hours. They will be recorded and posted on YouTube (if all players agree). Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend. A slot in the first session is reserved for Rich Rogers. (Note that the second session is American Thanksgiving Eve and plan accordingly.)

Aiming for a story of spooky monsters and spunky hunters, not outright horror. Expect slaying, sass, and scares commensurate with episodes of Buffy or Supernatural. The X-Card, Open Door Policy, and Lines and Veils will be in use. This event abides by the Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy.

2019-11-21T01:00:00Z → 2019-11-21T04:00:00Z Session One

2019-11-28T01:00:00Z → 2019-11-28T04:00:00Z Session Two

item.title: Last Fleet (Tuesdays in Nov - 19:30 UK time)
item.dc:creator: @rabalias
item.description:
@rabalias wrote:

original (1).jpg850×387 90 KB

This is playtest of my forthcoming game Last Fleet . I need all players to attend every session, please. You must RSVP to all four sessions.

I would like to record the sessions if I can figure out the technology in time.

Last Fleet is a PBTA game where you play brave pilots, officers, engineers and politicians on board a rag-tag fleet of ships, fleeing across space from an implacable, inhuman adversary. The game’s central theme is around pressure: pressure on individuals, pressure on the fleet. The mechanics reinforce this through gradual build-up of Pressure, which can lead to characters hitting Breaking Point, meaning they do something risky or irrational.

Gameplay has three significant elements: intrigue, action and FEELS. Intrigue is around holding the fractured peoples of the fleet together and hunting for traitors and sleeper agents. Action is mostly around space battles and suchlike. FEELS is how you tackle your Pressure. Build relationships or let loose with hedonism - either way you’ll introduce complications and emotional ties that make the intrigue and action all the juicier.

If you want to talk to me about the game, either hit me up on here, or email me at lastfleet (at) vapourspace (dot) net. Don’t leave comments on the event postings as it may take me a long time to notice them!

I’ll be using the X Card, and happy to pick up any other safety tools if the group are keen. Please see the Gauntlet inclusivity policy for more details.

item.title: Masks: Freaky Friday
item.dc:creator: @Alexi_Sarge
item.description:
@Alexi_Sarge wrote:

Posting on behalf of the GM, Leah Sarge:

Masks: Freaky Friday

swap.jpg564×852 65.7 KB

(Image credit: https://www.pinterest.com/pin/533958099570548347)

It was a normal day in Halcyon City—killer robots, mutated scientists, invading aliens, whatever. But then something went wrong and your intrepid team all wound up in the wrong bodies.

Because of the premise of this two-shot, you should sign up only if you plan to play in both sessions. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend.

The session is scheduled for 3 hours. It will be recorded and posted on YouTube (if all players agree). One slot is reserved for @Alexi_Sarge.

In this two-shot, players will create characters, establish team backstory, and then begin an adventure. At some point, you’ll get into more trouble than you bargained for and the whole team will wind up scrambled. The Delinquent might end up passing for the trusted Legacy, the Transformed could be freed from her monstrous form only to find she’s now… the Outsider (“C’mon!”). It’ll be up to you and the dice to see if you get back to your original bodies. (Oh, and save the day).

Switching bodies will mean switching playbooks. And non-core playbooks may be acceptable, if you run them by me first.

We’ll use Lines and Veils and the X-card as our primary safety tools, and the Open Door policy will be in effect. This series is operating under the Gauntlet’s inclusivity policy, on which more information can be found here (http://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html).

2019-11-15T01:00:00Z → 2019-11-15T04:00:00Z Session One
2019-11-22T01:00:00Z → 2019-11-22T04:00:00Z Session Two

item.title: Coriolis - the Third Horizon (Resistance Toolbox Hack)
item.dc:creator: @darren
item.description:
@darren wrote:

You will be required to read setting material from the core rulebook. If you do not have time, cannot make time or will not make time to read this material before your first session, please do not sign up for any sessions.

Screen Shot 2019-10-06 at 12.56.40.jpg1044×1044 275 KB

Coriolis - the Third Horizon is a science fiction role playing game set in a remote cluster of star systems called the Third Horizon. It is a place ravaged by conflicts and war, but also home to proud civilizations, both new and old. Here, the so called Firstcome colonists of old worship the Icons, while the newly arrived Zenithians pursue an aggressive imperialistic agenda through trade and military power.
In this game, you will crew a space ship and travel the Horizon. You will explore the ancient ruins of the Portal Builders, undertake missions for the powerful factions and partake in the game of political intrigue on Coriolis station – the center of power in the Third Horizon. You might even encounter strange beings from the Dark Between the Stars.
From the Monolith in the jungles of Kua to the floating temples of Mira, the Horizon is yours to explore. You can be traders, explorers, mercenaries, pilgrims or agents. Whatever your calling is, together you will make your own fate. In the end you might even discover the truth about the mysterious Emissaries and the threat of the Dark Between the Stars.

These are four sessions of Free League’s Coriolis - the Third Horizon using my adaptation of the ruleset to the Resistance Toolbox by Grant Howitt and Christopher Taylor found in Spire: the City Must Fall and Heart: the City Beneath. We will use Google Hangouts. Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must sign up for each session you wish to attend.

Safety Tools: We will use Script Change and Lines and Veils during our sessions. We will observe the Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy.

item.title: [Gauntlet Comics] Vigilante Hack (Tuesday evenings in Nov)
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

In November for Gauntlet Comics, I’m running Vigilante Hack!

aUQS25G.png525×525 287 KB

The Vigilante Hack is not a superhero game. While yes, some vigilantes in The Vigilante Hack are considered heroes and some wear costumes, including capes and masks, there is nothing “super” about them. They don’t have X-ray vision. They cannot run faster than cars. They cannot leap buildings in a single bound and they most definitely are not bullet-proof.

The vigilantes in The Vigilante Hack are normal people, the same as you and I, who have become fed up with the lawless individuals, thugs, organized crime and villains and have decided to do something about it! They have trained hard, sometimes to the point of obsession, and have struck back at those very people who are ruining their city. Think Batman, not Superman. Think The Punisher, not Spider-Man. Think Hit Girl not Wonder Woman.

Being a vigilante can be a thankless and even deadly calling. You may get arrested. You may pick a fight that you can’t win. You may find yourself looking down the barrel of a villain’s gun or you may even cross the line of right and wrong and become the exact thing that you started out trying to stop.

This game is part of the ongoing Gauntlet Comics series. Characters and settings created in this miniseries will exist in the Gauntlet Comics canon (and on our wiki) for future miniseries.

Being able to attend every session is not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend.

This game session will be recorded for future publication.

The Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy will be in play and the X-Card) safety tool will be in use.

Wednesday, November 6, 2019 1:00 AM → Wednesday, November 6, 2019 4:00 AM Session 1
Wednesday, November 13, 2019 1:00 AM → Wednesday, November 13, 2019 4:00 AM Session 2

item.title: Star Wars Saturdays: The Veil (Saturday Mornings in November)
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

Emperor Palpatine is dead.

SWS-TheVeil-01.jpg720×720 196 KB

Moments ago, the Alliance to Restore the Republic destroyed the second and final Death Star over the forest moon of Endor. The Empire is shattering even as you read this on your holoscreen back on Coruscant, the world that was once the Imperial Capital. And who are you? You’re just some cybered-up punk trying to navigate a world in complete turmoil, ducking Coruscant Security, playing the angles with the Corporate sectors, and staying one step ahead of the Black Sun, the Criminal organization trying to take over the HoloNet Relays.

The Veil is a collaborative storytelling game Powered by the Apocalypse designed to tell cyberpunk stories of your own making. Use world-building tools to come up with unique settings that look and feel like the cyberpunk you and your friends have always wanted. Put questions that drive your characters at the heart of heists, mysteries, and conspiracies. Break a futuristic world and then try to put it back together. Play to find out what happens.

This game is part of the ongoing Star Wars Saturdays series. The time setting is the end of Episode VI of the Star Wars movie series (that’s Return of the Jedi) when the Empire was in control, Jedi were few and hunted, and the rebellion was growing in fits and starts. Characters and settings created in this miniseries will exist in the SWS canon for future miniseries.

There will be 3 sessions in total. Being able to attend each session is ideal but not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend. The sessions will be recorded as Unlisted on my YouTube channel, but will not be shared or released unless all participating players agree.

The Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy will be in play and the X-Card) safety tool will be in use.

Saturday, November 2, 2019 2:00 PM → Saturday, November 2, 2019 5:00 PM Session 1
Saturday, November 9, 2019 3:00 PM → Saturday, November 9, 2019 6:00 PM Session 2

item.title: Demihumans: Life in the Fallen Age
item.dc:creator: @RobertBohl
item.description:
@RobertBohl wrote:

I’m going to be running my new game for The Gauntlet, and I’d love it if you’d join me. Some details:

  • Demihumans is a hack of Apocalypse World where the apocalypse is the death of everything and everyone magical. Your enclave—a nonhuman community under the control of a human city—is under constant threat, and you play the people who are trying to keep it together and make it thrive. You can see the playbooks, moves, and so on in the play packet.
  • For the first three days, I’d ask nonwhite people only to sign up. Given the subject matter of the game and who I am, it’s important to me to diversify the playtest pool.
  • This will be 4 sessions in total, and run on Tuesdays in November, from 7 pm to 11 pm Eastern time. Sessions will be 3 hours and will not be recorded.
  • You don’t have to attend every session of this series, but it’s appreciated. if you can. RSVP to each event separately.

item.title: Monster of the Week-- Pequossette in Winter
item.dc:creator: @Jesseabe
item.description:
@Jesseabe wrote:

Monster of the Week-- Pequossette in Winter Tuesdays in November at 8 PM Eastern Pequossette, MA, a quiet beach town connected to the North Shore of Massachusetts by a single road on a narrow spit of land, especially in winter when the tourists pack up and head home. But lately, strange things have started to happen around Pequossette, or PQ as it is affectionately known by locals. Nobody’s quite ready to talk about what they are yet, not above a whisper, but in a town this small, everybody seems to know about them. Seems they’re all really worried what might happen when the first big storm shuts down Neck Road, and cuts the town off from the mainland…

These are 4 sessions of Monster of the Week, Michael Sand’s PbtA game patterned on television serials like Buffy the Vampire Slayer, the X-Files and Supernatural. We will be playing a fairly open game in the setting discussed above, a fictional beach town on the North Shore of Massachusetts in the off-season. Session one will be taken up with character creation, as well as collaboratively filling out the setting and beginning the first mystery. After that, we’ll play to find out what happens.

In addition to the core book, we will be using @jexjthomas’ modified basic move triggers. The alternate weird moves from Tome of Mysteries will be available, should players want them, as well as the additional playbooks.

We will be using the X-card and Brie-Beau Sheldon’s script change tools. For more information on the Gauntlet’s safety tools, please refer to our Inclusivity Policy on the website (http://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html).

item.title: Sign in Stranger: Making Contact
item.dc:creator: @Julian
item.description:
@Julian wrote:

sis.jpg598×900 239 KB

Your life on Earth is over.

First contact with alien life has occured, at catastrophic risk. Humanity turns down the chance to join the galactic community, but some individuals choose to leave Earth to explore the universe now open to them.

You play one of those who leave Earth, never to return. Changing and being changed by the new world they enter.

Enter a strange new world.

Sign in Stranger is a collaborative, long-term role-playing game by Emily Care Boss. Working together, players create a truly alien environment using mechanics inspired by mad-libs: random words are chosen as creative spring-boards for describing the beings and world around the humans. Over the course of weeks or months, the game takes the characters from exploring their nearby surroundings to taking part in politics and intrigue ranging across stellar systems.

We will be playing the game over four sessions. This is session 1 of 4. Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend.

This session is scheduled for 3 hours. It will not be recorded.

The X-Card will be in play and we will abide by the Gauntlet’s Inclusivity Policy (http://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html).

item.title: Veil'd Fantasy (Tu Nov/Dec 2PM Eastern)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

veil fantasy banner.jpg1080×360 343 KB

This is for six sessions of an urban fantasy hack of The Veil. We will reskin that PbtA cyberpunk game to explore the lives of characters in a high fantasy city. Attendance at all sessions is encouraged, but not required. Rules will be taught. In session one we will create characters, establish connections, and see how the city’s crushing your spirits.

We will begin with a blank slate for our city. Will it be more Sanctuary or Lanhkmar? More Ryoko Owari or Kaiin? In session one we will detail this city. Your playbooks will let you define certain features. For example, if you’re the Doppelganger you can tell us how monsters are viewed; if you’re the Guild Agent, how such institutions operate.

Sessions run November/December, with skips for holidays. Each will run 2 1/2 to 3 hours. We will record the session and use the X-Card for safety. If you sign up and your attendance or RSVP changes, please also send me a message at edige23 at gmail. I will send out a group email a week before the session with set up and invite details.

The Gauntlet Inclusivity Policy will be in play and the X-Card) safety tool will be in use.
